results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 095
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: A collapsable polypropylene dam deals with the need for irrigation in normal weather conditions and collapses to reduce pressure under flood conditions; a helical extrusion machine makes wire economically; the Cerebral Function Monitor monitors patients during and after surgery more economically and better than the EEG; REMCALC - Relative Motion Collision Avoidance Calculator helps large ships avoid accidents in heavy traffic areas.

results.title: Living science: how materials are changed
results.creator_credit: ACI Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Discusses characteristics and properties of chemical substances, concepts relating to the structure of matter, elements and compounds, how chemical changes occur and the importance of these changes in daily life. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Living Room
results.brief_description: A catalogue of assorted Sydneysiders pose for the camera “at home”. “Home is where to sleep” - Why do people live where they do? “Home is an extension of your personality” - Do people have a choice in the way they live? What does “home” mean? A photographic mosaic of faces and places, “Living Room” reveals surprising values and attitudes.
results.description: A catalogue of assorted Sydneysiders pose for the camera “at home”. “Home is where to sleep” - Why do people live where they do? “Home is an extension of your personality” - Do people have a choice in the way they live? results.title: Living outback on a farm
results.creator_credit: Nandor Jenes, Donald Batchelor and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Presents a view of life on a wheat farm in the Australian outback. Shows farming activities and indicates the necessity of a good water supply. Also shows the nearby town, local school and a picnic.

results.title: Living jazz
results.creator_credit: Jack Gold, John Hall, Paddy Whannel and BFI
results.brief_description: A candid study of the Bruce Turner Jump Band at work, at individual and group practice rehearsal, on tour and as they discuss and arrange their music. Music written and arranged by Bruce Turner. Instruments: Bruce Turner (Alto Sax), John Mumford (Trombone), Johnny Chilton (Trumpet), Colin Bates (Piano), Jim Bray (Bass), Johnny Armitage (Drums). Presented by Doug Dobell and Ken Lindsay.
